embeds.title: How to use Modmail??
embeds.description:
Modmail is the system we use to facilitate support with our users. Below is a comprehensive list of features you can use. 

> **Prefix**: `&`

> `<>` = Required Arguments
> `[]` = Optional Arguments

fields.name: `&ar <msg>`
fields.value:
**Example:** `&ar Harold is cheese`

Send an anonymous reply to the user. Anonymous replies only show the moderator's role in the reply.

fields.name: `&r <msg>`
fields.value:
**Example:** `&r Thomas likes eating`

Send an anonymous reply to the user. Anonymous replies only show the moderator's role in the reply.

fields.name: `&close [-s] [time/close]`
fields.value:
**Example(s):** 
`&close`  - Immediately closes the thread.
`&close -s 1h` - Closes thread in 1 hour, silently.
`&close cancel` - Cancels a timed close.
** **
Closes a modmail thread. The `time` option allows you to specify a delay. The `-s` switch allows you close it without notifying the user. the `cancel` command cancels a timed close.

fields.name: `&delete <supportMsgID>`
fields.value:
**Example:**
`&delete 6`


Delete your previous reply sent with `&r`. `<supportMsgID>` is the message number shown in front of staff replies in the thread channel.

fields.name: `&edit <supportMsgID> <newMSG>`
fields.value:
**Example(s):** 
`&edit 6 This is edited.`
`&edit 9 This is another edited msg.`

Edit your previous reply sent with `&r`. `<supportMsgID>` is the message number shown in front of staff replies in the thread channel.

fields.name: `&logs <userID> [-v/-s]`
fields.value:
**Example(s):**
`&logs 384849797674172416 -v -s`
`&logs 384849797674172416 -v`
`&logs 384849797674172416`

View previous Modmail logs with current user.
`-v` switch allows you to view channel and message IDs between the bot and the user (Useful for reporting messages to discord)
`-s` switch allows you to see only the messages to/from user. (ignores other messages)

fields.name: `&loglink [-v/-s]`
fields.value:
**Example(s):**
`&loglink 384849797674172416 -v -s`
`&loglink 384849797674172416 -s`
`&loglink 384849797674172416`

Exact same as `&logs`, but allows you to view the current thread.

fields.name: `&block <userID> [time]`
fields.value:
**Example:**
`&block 384849797674172416 10d`

Prevent user from using Modmail for a specified amount of time. Not including `[time]` will prevent them from using modmail indefinitely

fields.name: `&suspend`
fields.value:
**Example:** `&suspend`

Suspends the thread: The thread will act as closed and will not recieve any messages until `&unsuspend`ed.

fields.name: `&alert`
fields.value:
**Example:** `&alert`

Pings you when the thread gets a new reply.

fields.name: `&alert cancel`
fields.value:
**Example:** `&alert cancel`

Cancels the ping set by `&alert`

fields.name: `&dm_channel_id`
fields.value:
**Example:** `&dm_channel_id`

Prints the channel ID of the current DM channel with user.

fields.name: `&newthread <userID>`
fields.value:
**Example:**
`&newthread 384849797674172416`

Opens a modmail thread with a specified user ID.

fields.name: `&message <supportMsgID>`
fields.value:
**Example:** `&message 3`

Sends all IDs of a certain message (channels, message, message link).

`<supportMsgID>` is the message number shown in front of staff replies in the thread channel.

fields.name: `&is_blocked <userID>`
fields.value: Queries if the specified user is blocked or not.
